CatDescriptText: Mr. Paul Jones, 6529 Shetland Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 28, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "What do you think is wrong with the Pittsburgh Pirates? Do you think that they are using their best ball players at all times?" answer reads: "No, I don't think that he does.  I think that the policeman has to close his eyes to some people who are law violators.  IN my opinion, 'Standard Order of Procedure' is that you don't do certain things nor make certain arrests."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Paul Jones wearing plaid button down collared shirt and dark striped hat, standing in front of building corner, right store window displaying picture of Asian girl, 4th Avenue Hotel in background, possibly corner of Fourth Avenue and Wood Street, Downtown
